intro: Hieronyma poasana, commonly known as the Brazilian beautyberry, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its clusters of small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its fruit is a small, dark purple berry that contains several seeds. Hieronyma poasana is often found in moist, shaded areas of tropical and subtropical forests.
